attributes.title: Skoden Seeking Storytellers
attributes.body:
Are you a storyteller? Want to share your story with us?

In episode 3, the Skoden Chronicles explored indigenous oral traditions and the trickster figures that are often portrayed in our stories. We would like to once again focus on the oral tradition by bringing storytellers from around Turtle Island and sharing their knowledge with us. We are seeking 3-4 stories from indigenous people who have a right to tell the stories they share - we don't need any more Joseph Boyden's on the show, do we?

Participants should be available on July 2-4, 2017 to record via phone or Skype and who are of First Nations, Inuit, or Metis lineage. A small honorarium may be available for their time.

To submit your story, please contact us through the Skoden Chronicles website, or on Twitter or Facebook. Please submit your full name, email, and what community you are from, along with a brief synopsis of your story. Only those who are selected will be notified.

HOW TO CONTACT US:

  • Our Website - Contact Form
  • Twitter - @SkodenPodcast
  • Facebook - Skoden Chronicles

attributes.title: Call Out: Articles, essays, stories and poems on #Reoccupation
attributes.body:
On June 28, a number of organizers including a group of Bawaating Water Protectors from Sault Ste. Marie put together an event called Reoccupation which lasted until July 1, 2017. It's purpose was to establish an indigenous presence within Canada150 celebrations in the heart of Canada's colonial empire - Parliament hill, Ottawa, ON. Participants were met with police aggressiveness who tried to stop the raising of a tipi and sacred fire for the purposes of a ceremony. With anti-indigenous sentiment abound and the world watching, the organizers succeeded in their endevour. The ceremony took place for four days, at which point the tipi came down on the organizer's own accord.

If you were a part of the #Reoccupation ceremony, Skoden Chronicles is releasing a call out for essays, articles, short stories, and poems that capture the spirit of Reoccupation. We are looking for authors to write about the following themes:

  • Chronological events: What happened from Day 1 - 4
  • Inside the Tipi: Mostly from perspective of the organizers, Water Protectors, and organizers of Black Lives Matter - Toronto
  • Perspectives on RCMP response
  • Analyses on media coverage
  • Settler Ally Perspectives
  • The Sacred Fire

If you wish to submit your work, please email us a 500-word abstract on your piece through our contact page. For poetry or artwork pieces, please send your submission as is.

DEADLINE: August 31, 2017.

This will be a peer-reviewed process for an anthology collection. Only successful candidates will be emailed back.

attributes.title: Skoden's making some changes!
attributes.body:
Due to SoundCloud's not-so-clear future, we've decided to migrate our podcast to another hosting site. As such, there may be some interuptions of service from our website as we have to make some internal technical changes. For the most part, the website will be functional but if glitches or bugs appear, we will be well aware of them. We expect these changes to span over the next couple of weeks.

As always, all our podcast episodes are still available on Soundcloud as long as its continues providing its service. The changes Skoden Chronicles are understaking will ensure that our programming stays consistent and you will always have something to listen to where ever you decide to listen to Skoden. Hey, we won't judge - your cousins might, but we won't.

For more information, please use our still-functional contact page to reach any member of our team.

Thank you for your patience and understanding
